senses.de: Something that you accomplished, often through hard work or skill
senses.ex: Winning the gold medal was a great achievement for the young athlete.

Tips.title: Hard-Earned Success
Tips.description: Refers to success gained after putting in significant effort or overcoming challenges.
Tips.example: After studying tirelessly, graduating with honors was her crowning achievement.

Tips.title: Great Importance
Tips.description: Used to describe something of great value or a milestone in someone's life or career.
Tips.example: The scientist's breakthrough in research was a monumental achievement.

Tips.title: Pride and Joy
Tips.description: Often accompanied by personal pride or happiness.
Tips.example: His first published novel was an achievement that filled him with joy.

senses.ex: She concentrated all her efforts on the achievement of her goal.

Tips.title: Focused Effort
Tips.description: Emphasizes the need for concentration and dedication to attain a specific goal.
Tips.example: Achievement of his goals required undivided attention and hard work.

Tips.title: Step-by-Step Progress
Tips.description: Indicates that achievement can be a gradual process, involving smaller goals that lead to a larger one.
Tips.example: Each chapter completed is a step toward the achievement of finishing her book.

Tips.title: End Result
Tips.description: Focuses on the final outcome or the result of efforts, regardless of the time taken.
Tips.example: The achievement of the project came after years of research.

senses.de: In video games, a task or quest that a player can complete for rewards or recognition
senses.ex: Unlocking all the in-game achievements may take several hours of gameplay.

Tips.title: Gaming Milestones
Tips.description: Refers to specific goals set by a game, often challenging and rewarding.
Tips.example: Finishing the secret level was an achievement that only dedicated players could reach.

Tips.title: Player Recognition
Tips.description: May give players recognition such as a badge or a place on a leaderboard.
Tips.example: Her online profile showcased several rare game achievements.

Tips.title: Gaming Community
Tips.description: Achievements can foster community interaction, discussion, and competition among gamers.
Tips.example: Discussing how to unlock a difficult achievement became a hot topic in the gaming community.

Accomplishment.wordDefinition:
Accomplishment refers to something that has been completed or achieved by an individual or a group that requires skill, effort, and hard work.

In summary, accomplishments typically refer to personal goals or tasks, while achievements refer to broader successes with greater recognition or significance.

Attain.wordDefinition:
Attain means to reach or gain something that was desired or aimed for. It mainly refers to reaching a goal or objective.

For example, if someone wanted to attain good grades, they would study and work hard to achieve that goal.

Achievement refers to the accomplishment of a task while attain means to reach a goal or objective. Achievement implies completing something while attain implies reaching something.

Completion.wordDefinition:
The main difference between achievement and completion is that achievement refers to the successful accomplishment of a specific goal or objective, whereas completion refers to the finishing of a task or project.

Completion applies to the finishing of a task or project. It does not necessarily imply success or personal accomplishment, but rather that the task or project has been finished.

For example, completing a homework assignment or finishing a puzzle could be considered a completion.

Achievement refers to successful accomplishment of a specific goal, while completion simply refers to finishing a task or project.

Fulfil.wordDefinition:
Fulfil refers to a sense of satisfaction or completion that someone experiences when they have met a goal or achieved something they set out to do.

Both words are applicable in different situations, but achievement is more focused on a specific outcome, while fulfill is more focused on a person's overall satisfaction with their efforts and accomplishments.

For example, someone can achieve a goal of losing weight, but still not feel fulfilled if they didn't actually enjoy the process.

On the other hand, someone may not have achieved a specific goal, but still feel fulfilled because they gave it their all and enjoyed the experience.

Performance.wordDefinition:
Performance refers to how well one does in a given task or activity, such as hitting a home run or doing well on a test.

While achievement often involves an end goal, performance may be more focused on the process of working towards that goal.

Realization.wordDefinition:
Achievement refers to the successful completion of a task or goal that has been set, whereas realization refers to the moment when one understands something that was previously unknown or unclear to them.

For example, receiving a diploma after graduating from high school is an achievement, while realizing that you have a passion for literature is a realization.

Achievements are typically associated with concrete outcomes, while realizations pertain to internal understandings or mental processes.

Achievements can be measured and quantified, whereas realizations tend to be more subjective experiences.

Success.wordDefinition:
Achievement connotes the accomplishment of a specific goal or task, while success implies overall prosperity and accomplishment.

Achievement is typically more qualitative, while success is more quantitative. For example, if someone achieves their goal of finishing a marathon, that is an achievement.

However, if that person has a successful career as a professional athlete, that is success. Achievements are more tangible and specific, while success is more subjective and overarching.

Both words can be applicable in different contexts: achievement in sports, education, or personal endeavors while success in finance, career, or overall happiness.

Triumph.wordDefinition:
Triumph means winning over challenges or hardships; it especially refers to a victory or success in a difficult or competitive situation.

Triumph represents a greater feeling of success, whereas achievement is more about the process or journey towards a goal.

For example, getting an A on an exam is an achievement, but winning a championship or overcoming a personal struggle is a triumph.

Victory.wordDefinition:
Victory involves winning a competition or defeating an opponent. It is applicable when someone emerges as the winner in a contest, such as a sports match or an election.

An achievement is a personal accomplishment, while victory is often the result of competing against others.

videos.Text: The discovery of the structure of DNA was one of the most important scientific achievements in the last century, in human history, in fact.

quotes.Text: Creativity is a great motivator because it makes people interested in what they are doing. Creativity gives hope that there can be a worthwhile idea. Creativity gives the possibility of some sort of achievement to everyone. Creativity makes life more fun and more interesting.
quotes.Title: English Psychologist
quotes.Name: Edward de Bono

quotes.Text: It is no great art to say something briefly when, like Tacitus, one has something to say; when one has nothing to say, however, and none the less writes a whole book and makes truth into a liar - that I call an achievement.
quotes.Title: Roman Poet
quotes.Name: Horace

quotes.Text: Trust yourself. Create the kind of self that you will be happy to live with all your life. Make the most of yourself by fanning the tiny, inner sparks of possibility into flames of achievement.
quotes.Title: Israeli Leader
quotes.Name: Golda Meir

quotes.Text: Fresh air is good if you do not take too much of it; most of the achievements and pleasures of life are in bad air.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

quotes.Text: It is not the clear-sighted who rule the world. Great achievements are accomplished in a blessed, warm fog.
quotes.Title: Polish Novelist
quotes.Name: Joseph Conrad

quotes.Text: I don't look at anything in my life as achievements. I look at them as experiences.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Jesse Itzler

quotes.Text: Individual achievements are not important for me, to be honest.
quotes.Title: German Athlete
quotes.Name: Toni Kroos

quotes.Text: If you raise a cool adult, that's an achievement.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Bobcat Goldthwait
